content:
• Monday, January 7, 2013
  • PLXS

    Plexus (NASDAQ:PLXS) -3.3% AH after warning it expects to report FQ1 (Dec. quarter) revenue of...

    Plexus (NASDAQ:PLXS) -3.3% AH after warning it expects to report FQ1 (Dec. quarter) revenue of $531M and EPS of $0.45-$0.47, below a consensus of $562.5M and $0.52. The contract manufacturer claims its networking/communications business didn't see "typical demand-pull" in the final weeks of the quarter. Plexus was clobbered in November after announcing the company's relationship one of its key networking customers, Juniper, will end this fiscal year.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:02 PM
  • KND

    Kinded Healthcare (NYSE:KND) lowers its FY13 guidance as a result of certain Medicare...

    Kinded Healthcare (NYSE:KND) lowers its FY13 guidance as a result of certain Medicare reimbursement changes included in the recently enacted American Taxpayer Relief Act. The company now expects FY13 earnings to come in between $1.10 - $1.30 per share, below previous EPS estimates of $1.20 - $1.40, on revenues of approximately $5.9B. Shares -1.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:51 PM
  • TISI

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: TISI +6%. VG +5%. CPE +4%. WTSLA +4%. AEO +4%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: TISI +6%. VG +5%. CPE +4%. WTSLA +4%. AEO +4%.
    After-hours top losers:     YUM -5%. CLMT -5%. MDRX -3%. VRNG -3%. SONS -3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:45 PM
  • YGE

    Yingli (NYSE:YGE) +3.5% AH after announcing it expects to report 2012 module shipments of more...

    Yingli (NYSE:YGE) +3.5% AH after announcing it expects to report 2012 module shipments of more than 2.2GW following a strong Q4 - that puts full-year shipments above Yingli's guidance of 2.1GW-2.2GW. Shares fell 6.8% in regular trading as part of a general rout in solar stocks.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:26 PM
  • YUM

    Yum Brands (NYSE:YUM) warns on China, expecting same-store sales there to be off 6% in Q4...

    Yum Brands (NYSE:YUM) warns on China, expecting same-store sales there to be off 6% in Q4 vs. an earlier forecast of -4% thanks to the effect on KFC sales in late December from the poultry contamination issue. The company continues to expect full-year EPS of $3.24. Shares -3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:08 PM | 9 Comments
  • ANDX

    Tesoro Logistics (TLLP) -1.5% AH after announcing a public offering of 8.5M common units, with...

    Tesoro Logistics (TLLP) -1.5% AH after announcing a public offering of 8.5M common units, with proceeds from the offering expected to fund a portion of TLLP's previously announced $400M acquisition of Chevron's Northwest Products pipeline system.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM
  • VOLC

    Volcano Corporation (NASDAQ:VOLC) gives an update on its Q4, saying it expects total revenue of...

    Volcano Corporation (NASDAQ:VOLC) gives an update on its Q4, saying it expects total revenue of $102.5M, in-line with the Street view, bringing expected FY12 revenues to approximately $382M, also in line with the consensus view. Complete results are to be available in late February. Shares -1.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • TISI

    Team, Inc. (NASDAQ:TISI): FQ2 EPS of $0.66 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $201M (+27% Y/Y) beats by...

    Team, Inc. (NASDAQ:TISI): FQ2 EPS of $0.66 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $201M (+27% Y/Y) beats by $19M. Shares +2.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • CAG

    ConAgra (NYSE:CAG) -1.5% AH after announcing a $240M common stock offering. CAG says it intends...

    ConAgra (NYSE:CAG) -1.5% AH after announcing a $240M common stock offering. CAG says it intends to use the net proceeds to fund, in part, the previously announced acquisition of Ralcorp Holdings.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM
  • QIHU

    While Baidu closes lower following a Barclays downgrade, Qihoo (QIHU +2.6%) has made new highs...

    While Baidu closes lower following a Barclays downgrade, Qihoo (QIHU +2.6%) has made new highs again with the help of a bullish note from Maxim Group. The firm says its checks indicate Qihoo has begun selling search ads, and may have also signed a rumored ad deal with Google. Maxim sees Google contributing to Q1 revenue, and expects Qihoo's split from the deal to be higher than the 33% it received for redirecting traffic to Google search from its browser.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • SQNM

    Sequenom (SQNM -2.3%) goes into the close a bit stronger than it started out the day, recovering...

    Sequenom (SQNM -2.3%) goes into the close a bit stronger than it started out the day, recovering some of its earlier 6% dip on some upbeat preliminary FY12 guidance posted over the weekend. The company said that it is expecting revenues of $89M, equating to a Y/Y growth rate of 59%, but the results were largely overshadowed by Illumina's (ILMN -7.3%) acquisition of Verinata, whose competing verifi test - which analyzes fetal DNA naturally found in a pregnant women's blood to look for missing or extra copies of chromosomes - carry's less risk than Sequenom’s SEQureDx technology.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM | 2 Comments
  • KOG

    Kodiak Oil & Gas (KOG +2.2%) sees upside into the close on takeover chatter after the...

    Kodiak Oil & Gas (KOG +2.2%) sees upside into the close on takeover chatter after the company reportedly canceled from an upcoming BMO conference. KOG's plentiful Williston Basin assets, worth as much as $13-$15/share, are said to have attracted interest from major oil players.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM | 6 Comments
  • SD

    The late-afternoon pop in SandRidge Energy (SD +3.8%) shares is attributed to ongoing M&A...

    The late-afternoon pop in SandRidge Energy (SD +3.8%) shares is attributed to ongoing M&A speculation following recent activist investor activity led by TPG-Axon, which is pushing to oust SD's board, unlock value by putting the company up for sale, and challenging the company's updated bylaws.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM | 5 Comments
  • BLRX

    BioLineRx (BLRX +2.3%) says Phase II/III results on BL-1020, an antipsychotic for the treatment...

    BioLineRx (BLRX +2.3%) says Phase II/III results on BL-1020, an antipsychotic for the treatment of schizophrenia, are expected during the week of March 18. The interim analysis, which measures the effect of the drug on cognitive function, will be performed on data of approximately 235 randomized patients from 27 sites in Romania and India.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM
  • ADM

    Archer Daniels Midland (ADM -4.2%) is initiated at Underweight with a $28 price target at J.P....

    Archer Daniels Midland (ADM -4.2%) is initiated at Underweight with a $28 price target at J.P. Morgan, which sees ADM's North American capacity (67% of total) remaining under pressure for the foreseeable future due to the Midwest drought and the resulting lack of supply of crops, which likely will hurt margins in ADM's oilseeds processing and ag services businesses in H1.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM | 1 Comment
  • MRK

    Trius Therapeutics (TSRX +0.7%) says the FDA has designated it's Phase 3 antibiotic candidate,...

    Trius Therapeutics (TSRX +0.7%) says the FDA has designated it's Phase 3 antibiotic candidate, tedizolid phosphate, as a Qualified Infectious Disease Product for acute bacterial skin and skin structure infections, as well as for hospital-acquired/ventilator-associated bacterial pneumonia. The designation enables the company to benefit from certain incentives for the development of new antibiotics, including priority review and fast-track status.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:02 PM
  • ANDV

    Tesoro (TSO -5.3%) amends a credit pact to allow for as much as $4B in borrowings under a...

    Tesoro (TSO -5.3%) amends a credit pact to allow for as much as $4B in borrowings under a revolver that has a current capacity of $1.85B. Its Tesoro Logistics (TLLP -2.2%) subsidiary also boosts a credit line to $500M from $300M, with the ability to increase borrowings to $650M. Howard Weil cuts TSO shares, along with Phillips 66 (PSX -3.2%), Valero (VLO -2.9%) and other refiners.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • RPRX

    Repros Therapeutics (RPRX +1.7%) provides a clinical update of its Phase 3 DEXA study, saying...

    Repros Therapeutics (RPRX +1.7%) provides a clinical update of its Phase 3 DEXA study, saying that recruiting is running better than expected, and that 83% of men with secondary hypogonadism are on target to be successfully treated with no testosterone levels achieved beyond the normal range. Enrollment should ensure mid-2014 NDA submission.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM
  • CELG

    Celgene Corp. (CELG +3.1%) updates guidance, saying it expects FY12 income to come in at the...

    Celgene Corp. (CELG +3.1%) updates guidance, saying it expects FY12 income to come in at the higher end of previous estimates and in-line results for 2013. Net product sales are expected to double between 2013 and 2017, reaching over $12B, with numerous milestones expected in 2013 for three "potential blockbuster" drugs. One of the drugs is its existing cancer drug Abraxane, which it hopes to have approved as a treatment for pancreatic cancer - which is among the hardest to treat - sometime this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM
  • CMP

    Compass Minerals (CMP -0.5%) names Fran Malecha as its new CEO, leaving his post as head of...

    Compass Minerals (CMP -0.5%) names Fran Malecha as its new CEO, leaving his post as head of Glencore's (OTCPK:GLCNF -1.5%) recently acquired North American agriculture business just a month into the job. Movement in senior management is not uncommon after takeovers, but the timing is not helpful for Glencore, as the company has little operational experience in North America.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM
  • BABY

    Natus Medical (BABY +3.5%) has agreed to buy Astro-Med's (ALOT +1.8%) Grass Technologies Product...

    Natus Medical (BABY +3.5%) has agreed to buy Astro-Med's (ALOT +1.8%) Grass Technologies Product Group for $18.6M in cash, in an effort to further expand its international presence. BABY says Grass will also add to its disposable product offerings and an entry into the research segment of the neurodiagnostic market. The deal is expected to close by the end of January.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM
  • PLCM

    Shares of Polycom (PLCM +4.3%) move up today on an upgrade to Outperform rating at Northland...

    Shares of Polycom (PLCM +4.3%) move up today on an upgrade to Outperform rating at Northland Securities with a price target of $14.50. Northland says stabilizing product demand should give a gradual boost to it bottom line, which should translate into a return to growth during the second half.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM
  • NVDA

    The Street isn't a fan of Nvidia's (NVDA -2.5%) entry into the handheld console market: shares...

    The Street isn't a fan of Nvidia's (NVDA -2.5%) entry into the handheld console market: shares are ticking lower as concerns about the costs of supporting Project Shield outweigh any enthusiasm about its latest baseband and app processors. CNNMoney's Adrian Covert notes Nvidia (unlike Nintendo and Sony) is trying to carve a niche by courting hardcore gamers with its console. Nvidia also launched its cloud-based Grid Gaming System (previous) yesterday. Supported by several cloud gaming providers, Grid features 20 servers and 240 Nvidia GPUs per rack.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:58 PM
  • SMED

    Medical waste disposal firm Sharps Compliance (SMED +4.2%) moves up after announcing earlier...

    Medical waste disposal firm Sharps Compliance (SMED +4.2%) moves up after announcing earlier that its Board of Directors has approved a $3M stock buyback Although the total dollar amount is small in size, it represents nearly 9% of the float.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:34 PM | 2 Comments
  • TSLA

    While most of its solar peers sell off, SolarCity (SCTY +11.1%) has soared to new post-IPO highs...

    While most of its solar peers sell off, SolarCity (SCTY +11.1%) has soared to new post-IPO highs after five IPO underwriters launched coverage with bullish ratings. As a solar panel installer/electricity seller, SolarCity's business model is very different from those of module/wafer/polysilicon sellers struggling with major overcapacity, demand, and pricing problems. (2013 guidance)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:29 PM | 1 Comment
  • NFLX

    A downward move in Netflix (NFLX +1.1%) from session highs lights a fire under rumors Carl Icahn...

    A downward move in Netflix (NFLX +1.1%) from session highs lights a fire under rumors Carl Icahn might be exiting his position. The investor holds just a shade under 10% of the company with plenty of unrealized profit sitting on the books. A more likely reason for the pullback could be that some other investors of the non-Icahn type sold off as shares cleared $100 for the first time since April.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:24 PM
  • TMUS

    MetroPCS (PCS -2.3%) trades lower after announcing it lost 93.2K subs in seasonally strong Q4....

    MetroPCS (PCS -2.3%) trades lower after announcing it lost 93.2K subs in seasonally strong Q4. That's better than the 312.3K subscriber loss it saw in Q3, but worse than the 197.4K gain the prepaid carrier witnessed a year ago. The decline likely has much to do with tougher prepaid competition from nationwide carriers. Churn stood at 3.6%, down slightly from Q3's 3.7%, and 4G LTE subs rose 117% Q/Q to 2.2M (26% of MetroPCS' base). Merger partner T-Mobile USA has also been losing subs.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:16 PM
  • GERN

    Shares of Geron (GERN +2.5%) snd BioTime (BTX +7.6%) both rise today after BTX agrees to buy the...

    Shares of Geron (GERN +2.5%) snd BioTime (BTX +7.6%) both rise today after BTX agrees to buy the intellectual property, including patents and patent applications, and other assets related to GERN's human embryonic stem cell programs. The financial terms of the deal were in a letter of intent announced back in mid-November.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:15 PM
  • ORLY

    A downgrade from Piper Jaffray on O'Reilly Automotive (ORLY -1.3%) to Neutral from Overweight is...

    A downgrade from Piper Jaffray on O'Reilly Automotive (ORLY -1.3%) to Neutral from Overweight is cutting a wide swath in the auto parts sector. The investment firm sees a major headwind for O'Reilly and peers in a couple of years when less vehicles will be under a year old. Decliners: AZO -1.6%, PBY-OLD -1.9%, AAP -0.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:03 PM
  • MITK

    Mitek (MITK +3.4%) trades higher after announcing the USPTO has granted a mobile image...

    Mitek (MITK +3.4%) trades higher after announcing the USPTO has granted a mobile image capture/processing patent that's relevant to the company's mobile check deposit solution. Mitek is embroiled in multiple patent disputes related to its mobile image capture IP. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM
  • CRZO

    Lanzhou Haimo Technologies confirms a deal to invest $27.5M in Carrizo Oil & Gas' (CRZO...

    Lanzhou Haimo Technologies confirms a deal to invest $27.5M in Carrizo Oil & Gas' (CRZO -2.9%) Niobrara energy assets in Colorado, China Daily reports, marking the first investment by a private Chinese company into shale oil and gas exploration in a U.S. oilfield. In return, Lanzhou will receive a 14.29% stake in the assets. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM | 2 Comments
  • Z

    Zillow (Z +10.2%) and (to a lesser extent) Trulia (TRLA +3.9%) are posting big gains...

    Zillow (Z +10.2%) and (to a lesser extent) Trulia (TRLA +3.9%) are posting big gains today.  Fannie Mae's December housing survey data could be giving the real estate sites a lift. And in Zillow's case, it's hard to overlook the fact over half its float was shorted as of Dec. 14.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM
  • ZGNX

    Zogenix (ZGNX +6.7%) moves up after announcing its preliminary Q4 sales figures today. The...

    Zogenix (ZGNX +6.7%) moves up after announcing its preliminary Q4 sales figures today. The company expects gross product sales of approximately $13.5M on 145,200 units shipped, with unit volume up approximately 9% sequentially from Q312 and 26% from Q411. For FY12, preliminary unaudited net product revenues were around $36M, up 18% over FY11, but slightly below previously issued guidance of $37M. Separately the drug developer adds that it's filed for a $75M mixed shelf registration.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM
  • CDMO

    Midday top 10 gainers: PPHM +67%. MDCI +28%. OTCQB:DLGC +24%. EPOC +22%. BIOL +21%. RFIL +21%....

    Midday top 10 gainers: PPHM +67%. MDCI +28%. OTCQB:DLGC +24%. EPOC +22%. BIOL +21%. RFIL +21%. BITA +16%. PRGN +15%. CHRM +15%. CBMX +15%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: HILL -20%. ESI-OLD -17%. STP -13%. SWSH -11%. OTC:PGRX -11%. PSEM -11%. IHT -11%. CDXS -10%. ACHN -10%. NED -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • SHPG

    ViroPharma (VPHM +3.4%) trades higher after releasing its 2013 outlook this morning. The company...

    ViroPharma (VPHM +3.4%) trades higher after releasing its 2013 outlook this morning. The company says it expects net product sales to be between $450M to $475M. Analysts are looking for around $467M. The numbers are encouraging, because Cinryze has become key to the drug developer's future as the it's former blockbuster antibiotic Vancocin is expected to see sales hurt by the potential entry of generic rivals going forward.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:38 PM | 1 Comment
  • FREEF

    Shipping stocks catch a wave with word out that shipping tycoon John Fredriksen might be looking...

    Shipping stocks catch a wave with word out that shipping tycoon John Fredriksen might be looking to expand with a new order for vessels. The development gives some hope up that the Baltic Dry Index, up 1% YTD, bottomed out in December and will start the march back to 1,000. Daily advancers: FREE +26.4%, ESEA +4.9%, NEWL +12.7%, SB +1.4%, GNK +1.9%, EGLE +2.6%, SHIP +7.4%, EXM +10.6%, PRGN +15.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • FSLR

    Many solar stocks have plunged after rallying strongly last week (likely thanks to...

    Many solar stocks have plunged after rallying strongly last week (likely thanks to short-covering). Among the big losers: FSLR -6.7%. SPWR -9.1%. STP -13.9%. LDK -9.8%. CSUN -8%. SA's Richard Pearson offered a detailed bear argument for Trina (TSL -2.8%) today: he estimates the company has $14B in off-balance-sheet liabilities related to polysilicon purchase deals, and thinks it could become insolvent in 2013 thanks to its cash burn and $800M in near-term debt maturities. On a positive note, the French government has unveiled new solar subsidies. (Gordon Johnson)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM | 1 Comment
  • SWN

    Southwestern Energy (SWN -1.6%) is downgraded to Hold from Buy at Dahlman Rose on concern about...

    Southwestern Energy (SWN -1.6%) is downgraded to Hold from Buy at Dahlman Rose on concern about an expected 2% decline in Fayetteville production in 2013 (~75% of total production) after shares outperformed gassy peers in 2012 (up 2% vs. down 38%). The firm says the decline of the key asset and an increased reliance on Marcellus to drive production growth will pressure shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM
  • NOK

    Alcatel-Lucent (ALU +4.6%) pops to $1.72 after getting pulled from Goldman's Conviction Sell...

    Alcatel-Lucent (ALU +4.6%) pops to $1.72 after getting pulled from Goldman's Conviction Sell list. This is probably a good time to point out Goldman helped underwrite last month's debt refinancing deal. Credit Suisse, the other underwriter, upgraded Alcatel to Neutral last week. Alcatel was added to Goldman's list on Oct. 5, when shares traded at $1.08.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM | 6 Comments
  • CREE

    Cree (CREE -6.1%) has sold off hard thanks to a downgrade to Hold from Canaccord, which thinks...

    Cree (CREE -6.1%) has sold off hard thanks to a downgrade to Hold from Canaccord, which thinks its margin expansion thesis (stemming from the migration of legacy LED components to Cree's SC3 platform) is "largely played out." The firm thinks future growth will driven by Cree's lighting business, which sports lower margins than its component ops.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM
  • AFFY

    Affymax (OTC:AFFY +5.4%) and Japanese drug maker Takeda Pharmaceuticals (TKPYY.PK) have entered...

    Affymax (OTC:AFFY +5.4%) and Japanese drug maker Takeda Pharmaceuticals (TKPYY.PK) have entered into a supply agreement for sourcing and supply of Omontys Injection with DSI Renal. Financial terms weren't disclosed, but the agreement allows DSI Renal to purchase the drug for use within its organization, provide discounts and rebates on the product in its selected centers, and then, based on ongoing evaluation, potentially expand to additional facilities.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM
  • CPLP

    Capital Product Partners (CPLP +3.4%) acquires from Capital Maritime & Trading two post...

    Capital Product Partners (CPLP +3.4%) acquires from Capital Maritime & Trading two post panamax container vessels; in return, CPLP contributes two VLCC tankers, both of which were under charter to Capital Maritime at $28,000/day.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM
  • CDMO

    Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM +82%) soars after the company says data on its experimental...

    Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM +82%) soars after the company says data on its experimental cancer drug bavituximab was not completely compromised by errors in a mid-stage trial. An internal review found the errors to concern only the lowest dose and placebo arms of the study. This means the drug should be able to enter into a late-stage trial, and PPHM is preparing for discussions with the FDA. PPHM had been tight-lipped about the trial errors since being discovered in September, which had caused shares to plunge.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM
  • BIOL

    Shares of Biolase (BIOL +16%) pops after posting upbeat Q4 guidance, now expecting revenues...

    Shares of Biolase (BIOL +16%) pops after posting upbeat Q4 guidance, now expecting revenues above $18M, primarily due to the increased demand for its flagship WaterLase iPlus and its new EPIC 10 soft tissue diode laser. The company also noted that it's expecting a substantial acceleration in the adoption of lasers over the next few years. Analysts are looking for $17.9M in revenues, putting the company's projection in-line to just slightly ahead of estimates.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM
  • HAR

    Harman International Industries (HAR +3.6%) is one of the S&P 500's big gainers today,...

    Harman International Industries (HAR +3.6%) is one of the S&P 500's big gainers today, boosted by an upgrade to Outperform at Baird. The firm notes a jump in contracts with major auto makers including Toyota (NYSE:TM) and BMW, which should drive high single-digit sales growth through 2015 and help to offset the potential for competition from an increase in smartphone usage. Harman however, doesn't see those devices as a threat.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM
  • VIAV

    JDS Uniphase (JDSU +2.3%) catches a bid after Stifel lifts its PT to $16 from $14, citing...

    JDS Uniphase (JDSU +2.3%) catches a bid after Stifel lifts its PT to $16 from $14, citing improving optical communications industry trends. UBS and Piper have also issued bullish notes in recent weeks, largely for similar reasons. With shares up nearly 40% since late October, is much of the good news now priced in?

     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • EA

    Electronic Arts (EA -2.4%) slips following a downgrade to Neutral from Sterne Agee. The firm...

    Electronic Arts (EA -2.4%) slips following a downgrade to Neutral from Sterne Agee. The firm thinks FY13 estimates are aggressive, declares EA to have a premium valuation, and has lowered its game sale expectations. EA has rallied a bit in recent months, but remains well below year-ago levels.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM
  • GMCR

    In an odd dichotomy, trading partners Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR -4.4%) and Coffee...

    In an odd dichotomy, trading partners Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR -4.4%) and Coffee Holdings (JVA +2.3%) move in opposite directions. While technical traders are quick to point out that GMCR broke through a technical trading level of resistance, a note out from Dougherty on K-Cup share appears to be tipping the sentiment.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM | 3 Comments
  • PKT

    Procera (PKT -3.5%) slips after announcing it's expanding into the enterprise deep packet...

    Procera (PKT -3.5%) slips after announcing it's expanding into the enterprise deep packet inspection hardware market by acquiring startup Vineyard Networks for CAD$28M ($28.3M) - 55% in stock, and 45% in cash. Vineyard's enterprise solutions complement Procera's service provider gear, and give companies a way of analyzing and prioritizing data traffic stemming from cloud services, BYOD hardware, and other external sources. Procera sees Vineyard adding $4M-$5M to its 2013 revenue, slightly diluting 2013 EPS, and boosting 2014 EPS.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM | 1 Comment
  • UHS

    Shares of Universal Health (UHS +1%) tick higher on an upgrade to Positive at Susquehanna over...

    Shares of Universal Health (UHS +1%) tick higher on an upgrade to Positive at Susquehanna over the weekend. The firm cites a number of catalysts over the near term, including growth in its behavioral unit and stabilizing results in acute care. The firm also raises its price target to $66 from $43.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • MU

    Micron (MU +4.3%) rallies after being added to Citi's Top Picks Live list; the firm sees a...

    Micron (MU +4.3%) rallies after being added to Citi's Top Picks Live list; the firm sees a cyclical rebound in memory prices giving Micron a lift. Citi's comments arrive as Digitimes reports Samsung (OTC:SSNLF) and others have raised their contract prices for 4GB PC DRAM modules following major 2012 declines. (Drexel Hamilton) (FQ3 results)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:10 AM | 1 Comment
  • MAKO

    MAKO Surgical (NASDAQ:MAKO) -5.8% but recovering from earlier lows after saying that it sold 15...

    MAKO Surgical (NASDAQ:MAKO) -5.8% but recovering from earlier lows after saying that it sold 15 of its Rio surgical systems in Q4 and 45 in 2012, taking the total installed based to 156. The number of orthopedic MAKOplasty procedures performed +29% Y/Y to 2,904 in Q4. Sells 11 MAKOplasty Total Hip Arthroplasty (THA) applications, of which three were sold to existing customers. THA procedures performed +31% Q/Q. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM | 1 Comment
  • IMAX

    Shares of IMAX (IMAX +5.2%) race out of the gate with early gains on what traders are calling a...

    Shares of IMAX (IMAX +5.2%) race out of the gate with early gains on what traders are calling a momentum run. On the fundamental side, JPMorgan's Townsend Buckles expects the company to post a strong earnings performance in 2013 and 2014 with its large-screen format very popular in emerging markets. The analyst also notes Q1 and Q3 could be tough comparables due to the the schedule of title releases this year compared to last year.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM | 1 Comment
  • AMAT

    Applied Materials (AMAT -2.5%) slides after receiving a downgrade to Underweight from JPMorgan's...
